verses.verse: Listen<WH8085> now to what Yahweh<WH3068> says:<WH559> "Arise,<WH6965> plead<WH7378> your case before the mountains,<WH2022> and let the hills<WH1389> hear<WH8085> what you have to say.<WH6963>

Hear,<WH8085> you mountains,<WH2022> Yahweh<WH3068>'s controversy,<WH7379> and you enduring<WH386> foundations<WH4146> of the earth;<WH776> for Yahweh<WH3068> has a controversy<WH7379> with his people,<WH5971> and he will contend<WH3198> with Israel.<WH3478>
My people,<WH5971> what have I done<WH6213> to you?<WH3811> How have I burdened you?<WH6030> Answer me!

For I brought you up<WH5927> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> and redeemed<WH6299> you out of the house<WH1004> of bondage.<WH5650> I sent<WH7971> before<WH6440> you Moses,<WH4872> Aaron,<WH175> and Miriam.<WH4813>

My people,<WH5971> remember<WH2142> now what Balak<WH1111> king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124> devised,<WH3289> and what Balaam<WH1109> the son<WH1121> of Beor<WH1160> answered<WH6030> him from Shittim<WH7851> to Gilgal,<WH1537> that you may know<WH3045> the righteous<WH6666> acts of Yahweh.<WH3068>"

How shall I come before<WH6923> Yahweh,<WH3068> and bow<WH3721> myself before the exalted<WH4791> God?<WH430> Shall I come before<WH6923> him with burnt offerings,<WH5930> with calves<WH5695> a year<WH8141> old?<WH1121>

Will Yahweh<WH3068> be pleased<WH7521> with thousands<WH505> of rams?<WH352> With tens of thousands<WH7233> of rivers<WH5158> of oil?<WH8081> Shall I give<WH5414> my firstborn<WH1060> for my disobedience?<WH6588> The fruit<WH6529> of my body<WH990> for the sin<WH2403> of my soul?<WH5315>

He has shown<WH5046> you,<WH120> O man, what is good.<WH2896> What does Yahweh<WH3068> require<WH1875> of you,<WH6213> but to act justly,<WH4941> to love<WH160> mercy,<WH2617> and to walk<WH3212> humbly<WH6800> with your God?<WH430>
Yahweh<WH3068>'s voice<WH6963> calls<WH7121> to the city,<WH5892> and wisdom<WH8454> sees<WH7200> your name:<WH8034> "Listen<WH8085> to the rod,<WH4294> and he who appointed it.<WH3259>
Are there<WH786> yet treasures<WH214> of wickedness<WH7562> in the house<WH1004> of the wicked,<WH7563> and a short<WH7332> ephah<WH374> that is accursed?<WH2194>
Shall I be pure<WH2135> with dishonest<WH7562> scales,<WH3976> and with a bag<WH3599> of deceitful<WH4820> weights?<WH68>
Her rich men<WH6223> are full<WH4390> of violence,<WH2555> her inhabitants<WH3427> speak<WH1696> lies,<WH8267> and their tongue<WH3956> is deceitful<WH7423> in their speech.<WH6310>
Therefore I also have struck<WH2470> you with a grievous wound.<WH5221> I have made you desolate<WH8074> because of your sins.<WH2403>

You shall eat,<WH398> but not be satisfied.<WH7646> Your humiliation<WH3445> will be in your midst.<WH7130> You will store up,<WH5253> but not save;<WH6403> and that which you save<WH6403> I will give up<WH5414> to the sword.<WH2719>

You will sow,<WH2232> but won't<WH7114> reap. You will tread<WH1869> the olives,<WH2132> but won't<WH5480> anoint yourself with oil;<WH8081> and crush grapes,<WH8492> but won't<WH8354> drink the wine.<WH8492>

For the statutes<WH2708> of Omri<WH6018> are kept,<WH8104> and all the works<WH4639> of the house<WH1004> of Ahab.<WH256> You walk<WH3212> in their counsels,<WH4156> that I may make<WH5414> you a ruin,<WH8047> and her inhabitants<WH3427> a hissing;<WH8322> And you will bear<WH5375> the reproach<WH2781> of my people.<WH5971>"
